result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian A Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with R. A. Grosch as named in the complaint.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian A Ladwig

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 10:23 pm case called. Defendant Christian A Ladwig in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses the repeater enhancer. Statement by victim.  Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 3 years WSP to be served as 1 year Initial Confinement & 2 years Extended Supervision. Consecutive to any existing sentence. CONDITIONS OF ES: No Contact with R. A. Grosch, as named in the complaint. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court directs 25% PIA. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds the defendant not eligible for CIP or SAP. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:10 AM: Defendant Christian A Ladwig in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  It is believed that Def will be waiving pre-lim today based upon an offer extended.  Terms of offer extended recited by the State.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed.  INFO Stated - Receipt Acknowledged - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered to charges alleged in the INFO.  As to previous demand for speedy trial made at the IA.  Def continues his demand for speedy trial.  Atty Zamzow states Def is wishing an opportunity to review discover and wants speedy trial demand preserved.  Atty Zamzow requests scheduling of P/S.  She confirms that more than likely matter will be resolved at the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Christian A Ladwig in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to have a preliminary hearing scheduled within the time limits.   State argues for $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by defense.  Court acknowledges speedy trial demand that would be honored at the time of ARGN.  Court directs Atty Zamzow to statutory reference as to speedy trial demand.  Atty Zamzow requests that Pre-Lim hrg to remain as scheduled.  Pre-Lim Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
